author: Debra Killalea
title: Donald Trump, Justin Trudeau handshake memes: Truth behind â€˜awkwardâ€™ photo
text:
LIFE is full of awkward moments, and when two leaders meet from opposite sides of the political divide itâ€™s fair to assume there will be plenty of these. 
And all it takes is just one photo and a picture-perfect expression for the internet to work its magic.
Cue meme gold.
US President Donald Trump and Canadian Prime Minister Donald Trump became their own meme following what appeared to be at first glance a very awkward handshake.
But on closer inspection, all is not quite what it seems.
Mr Trudeauâ€™s facial expression during this handshake captured some attention. Picture: Evan Vucci/AP Source: AP 
The two leaders were sitting in the Oval Office when Mr Trump extended his hand to his Canadian counterpart.
Mr Trudeau reached across and reciprocated the gesture in front of waiting media.
However thanks to one quick photographer, the expression on Mr Trudeauâ€™s face quickly became an internet meme, with many taking the photo out of context, or at least finding the funny side of it.
Some social media users commented that Mr Trudeauâ€™s face summed up how the whole world was feeling.
Today, we are all Justin Trudeau pic.twitter.com/woXgZshntj 
â€” Kim Kelly (@GrimKim) February 13, 2017 Trudeau resisting Trump's weird handshake is the biggest display of dominance in the history of Canada
â€” Brandy Jensen (@BrandyLJensen) February 13, 2017 Undoctored photo of Donald Trump looking for a handshake from Justin Trudeau pic.twitter.com/rx5DmFRH8T 
â€” Sir_Stride (@sirfrench17) February 13, 2017 Trudeau handled Trump's goofy handshake game like a champ. Well played, Canada. pic.twitter.com/FiHAZgF6DW 
â€” A.T. Lambert (@ATLamberto) February 13, 2017 Great Canadian victories
1. War of 1812
2. Gold medal hockey matches, 2010 Olympics
3. Trudeau-Trump handshake, 2017 pic.twitter.com/Q8i2DjXZ5E 
â€” Kelly Lamrock, Q.C. (@KLamrock) February 13, 2017 Justin Trudeau defeats the Trump handshake. Probably because he can do this: (you're welcome) pic.twitter.com/FAvQ4R2iVx 
â€” A.M. Pines (@AM_Pines) February 13, 2017 Justin Trudeau has clearly seen Trump's terrifying handshake. pic.twitter.com/R7ZqfeGOMT 
â€” Sarah Churchwell (@sarahchurchwell) February 13, 2017 . @realDonaldTrump : "Look my big boy hand. #Bannon made me sign a bunch of birthday cards. Whats an EO?" @JustinTrudeau : ... #FreeTrudeau pic.twitter.com/TjlOr5t3jZ 
â€” Unpresidented (@_DavidCarter_) February 13, 2017 In reality though hereâ€™s what really happened.
The leaders were due to attend a roundtable talk about the advancement of women in business before holding a joint press conference at the White House.
See, nothing awkward to see here at all. Picture: Saul Loeb/AFP Source: AFP 
The pair were sitting there smiling for the cameras and it seems as if a long time passes before they do actually shake hands.
In fact itâ€™s Mr Trump who seems to get the hint the media want a photograph of them shaking hands so he suggests they do just that.
No long handshake, but here are Trump & Trudeau in the Oval.

Trump: "I think they (the press) want a handshake" pic.twitter.com/yogZaymkME 
â€” Steve Kopack (@SteveKopack) February 13, 2017 However, while the handshake itself may not seem that awkward there were plenty of moments between the pair that didnâ€™t go unnoticed.
Many also commented on how Mr Trump greeted his Canadian counterpart outside the White House.
Check muscle flinch at 0:06
Trump tries his macho arm-yank handshake thing
But he gets nowhere, due to Trudeau's single-arm dumbbell rows https://t.co/DtQH2U5Xj9 
â€” Jonathan Kay (@jonkay) February 13, 2017 trump tried to do his weird pull-in dominance handshake but was easily overpowered by Trudeau https://t.co/bwsapD4PId 
â€” your friend (@ItsTonyNow) February 13, 2017 This is amazing. Trump is trying to overpower Trudeau in the handshake and Trudeau literally fighting back. https://t.co/qHqfSdWQp3 
â€” holly woodðŸŒ¹ (@girlziplocked) February 13, 2017 #TheResistance 

The handshake question. Some say Trump didn't try his strong arm jerk & pull. I think he did, but Trudeau is wicked strong. pic.twitter.com/bZxFty84J6 
â€” The Anti-Trump (@IMPL0RABLE) February 13, 2017 Social media users were also quick to point out the apparent awkwardness Mr Trump experienced during their joint press conference.
Mr Trudeau spoke of the two countries being long-time allies and trade partners before he switched to French.
The leaders pictured after their joint news conference. Picture: Evan Vucci/AP Source: AP 
Trudeau speaking French so eloquently whilst Trump struggles to grasp the English language ðŸ˜‚
â€” S.Shah (@shuj420) February 13, 2017 Trump seems confused by French-speaking Trudeau. It's like watching a dog who knows a few words. He looks up when Trudeau says "Trump"
â€” Sarah Kendzior (@sarahkendzior) February 13, 2017 Trudeau started speaking French, & Trump fumbled through papers for his earpiece. By the time he put it in, Trudeau was speaking English.
â€” Laurie Crosswell ðŸŒž (@lauriecrosswell) February 13, 2017 Trump when Trudeau started speaking French ðŸ˜„ pic.twitter.com/7pthuwbYwy 
â€” Shaan Haider (@shaanhaider) February 13, 2017 Mr Trump listens to an earpiece during the joint press conference. Picture: Saul Loeb Source: AFP 
Me watching Trudeau translate himself into French. pic.twitter.com/yazecf1Nvj 
â€” Alyssa Milano (@Alyssa_Milano) February 13, 2017 And it seems the Presidentâ€™s daughter didnâ€™t escape Twitterâ€™s attention either during the meeting between the North American leaders.
Mr Trudeau sat alongside Ivanka Trump during a roundtable discussion on women entrepreneurs and business leaders in the Cabinet Room of the White House and the internet quickly took notice.
Ivanka Trump and Justin Trudeau pictured during a roundtable discussion on women entrepreneurs and business leaders in the Cabinet Room of the White House. Picture: Saul Loeb/AFP Source: AFP 
After only 3 hours spent having her hair and makeup done, Ivanka meets w/Trudeau to discuss how to empower women. #TrudeauMeetsTrump #irony pic.twitter.com/42EDMl5sZZ 
â€” Can't We All... (@JeetoCheesus) February 13, 2017 The only thing Ivanka Trump and I have in common, is the way we look at Justin Trudeau. pic.twitter.com/3NEOkjhmtK 
â€” gabrielle (@gabbySLC) February 13, 2017 Either way, this wouldnâ€™t be the first time the internet has poked fun at Mr Trumpâ€™s handshake manner.
Last Friday, Mr Trump was pictured in an excruciating 30 second handshake with Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, which many said went on for far too long.
PM Shinzo Abe after Trump handshake: ðŸ˜µ pic.twitter.com/h0ayPS9pB9 
â€” Steve Kopack (@SteveKopack) February 10, 2017 And HBOâ€™s Last Week Tonight host John Oliver couldnâ€™t resist making fun of Mr Trumpâ€™s numerous handshake moments, collating a collection of the best ones.
Enjoy.
John Oliver - Trump's Handshake debra.killalea@news.com.au
